content: I proposed a release strategy in the description of this PR. https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/4405. Would like to know you guys thoughts
@Florian Diebold Chalk 0.11.0 is released. Can we start using it from crates.io in rust-analyzer? It should be released every Sunday 00:00 UTC
I think we're pretty up to date, so you could try switching RA to it and see whether it builds, otherwise I'll do it when I find the time ;)
I need to figure out what to do with test_utils package. It needs to be published and but not under that name
wow, chalk is developing so fast, I wonder what has pushed it

I pushed for automated publishing of a minor version every week. I am setting up the same thing for rust-analyzer too. These steps are needed if we want to use rust-analyzer as a base for code analysis tools (I am building one)

std::Veetaha said:

wow, chalk is developing so fast, I wonder what has pushed it

Probably https://blog.rust-lang.org/inside-rust/2020/03/28/traits-sprint-1.html. chalk development picked up speed recently.
It's really been a snowball with Chalk :) Work leads to exposure, which leads to interest, which leads to more work. And the cycle continues.
The sprints have been super helpful for organizing and somewhat broadcasting the work we do. And getting people involved
@matklad @Florian Diebold Here's the PR for automated publishing, https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/pull/4776
